hey my teacher gave us this article about security cameras in the uk and he asked us to post up our answers to a few questions so here it is: 1.How does the increasing use of cameras affect privacy? Everywhere we go, everything we do, somebody’s watching us. Now I don’t know about you but that makes me feel uncomfortable. Say you’re in a department store and you scratch your butt. That’s not all bad but it is embarrassing. But what about you reveal something about yourself to someone you trust. Something deep and dark. Something only meant for your ears and that friend. And there’s a surveillance camera taping it. Now that is wrong. 2.Where do you think it is fair to have cameras installed? Not fair? It’s fair to install cameras in banks, malls, big public places, anywhere that’s not private. It’s not fair to have cameras installed in a private residence against the owner’s will. 3.What is your opinion on this subject? Hey I think it’s good that they’re doing this. Just as long as they don’t install cameras in a private residence against the owner’s will. 4.If you feel that this is an invasion of privacy, how do you feel governments should help increase protection from the inclining terrorist threats? I don’t think that this is an invasion of privacy so much as it is protection. Like I said, just as long as they don’t install cameras in private residences against the owner’s will. enjoy (i think) :-S
